intro: Adeneleuterophora poiformis, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that bear small, alternate leaves. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, which are often subtended by bracts. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
